page.title: 06PUBLIC TRANSPORT IN HOOK
page.content: THE RAILWAYS - Mr Mustoe says that the railway was an important employer but only two people are working at the station today.The railway used to be the method of transporting flowers each day to Covent Garden. The station is still important with commuters into London, Farnborough and Basingstoke filling the carpark with cars.The station has recently been repainted in brown red and white with hanging baskets above the platforms.Trains leave half hourly to London and Basingstoke with extras at rush hours. THE BUSES - Mr Mustoe says there used to be frequent bus service from Hook. Today Alder Valley buses run hourly to Basingstoke and Odiham continuing on alternate hours either to Camberley via Hartley Wintney or to Aldershot via Farnham.Sunday and late evening services are infrequent.
